title: This Leech Had an Appetite for Something Other Than Blood
snippet: A 437-million-year-old fossil from a deposit in Wisconsin could be the oldest species of leech ever found.

subnews.title: NASA employees on Artemis missions with SpaceX, Blue Origin to work through shutdown

subnews.title: NASA closes doors to 15,000 employees as US government shutdown begins

title: Why do women outlive men? A study of 1,176 species points to an answer.
snippet: Women tend to live longer than men. There are traditional explanations: Men smoke more. They drink more. They tend to engage in riskier behavior.

subnews.title: Why women live longer than men

title: An Environmental Triumph 400 Million Years in the Making
snippet: This story is part of Fungi Week, a deep dive into the myriad ways mushrooms and fungi make the planet a healthier place for all its inhabitants.

subnews.title: Fungi Paved the Way for Terrestrial Life Far Earlier Than Previously Believed

title: Full Moon October 2025: When To See The ‘Harvest Supermoon’ Rise
snippet: Everything you need to know about October's full harvest “supermoon,” including exactly when, where, and how to see it at its best from where you are.

title: Detection of organic compounds in freshly ejected ice grains from Enceladus’s ocean
snippet: Saturn's moon Enceladus ejects a plume of ice grains and gases originating from a subsurface ocean via fractures near its south pole.
